reviews.title: SAiena, January 2007
reviews.text: The best thing this hotel offers are the tours. We took one that went to San Gimingano and to a winery. It was the best tour weve ever done. The winery portion was brilliant as you go to a local winemaker and sit atop the Tuscan hills as he takes you through his 'wine school'. The tour guide was also an outstanding individual. Well worth it even if your not usually a 'toury' type of person.
this is a great hotel 15 minutes from the campo our room was on the 5th floor overlooking the soccer stadium. i wonder what it would have been like if there was a game going on.
reviews.title: loved the Jolly

reviews.text: for some reason, this hotel always is "knocked" for being what it is---a business hotel. But, its in a great location, a good breakfast with the room, a very good dining room and really nice rooms after the remodel with all the modern ameneties.
reviews.title: tried and true

reviews.text: I have always thought this a very good hotel, and now, better. While not offering any great romanticisim or historic lineage, its a good hotel, especially in light of the alternatives.
reviews.title: Great place after the renovations

reviews.text: The Jolly is being renovated, but I didn't mind; it had been announced and didn't disturb. A modern, yet charminig hotel, excellent A/C or heat, friendly staff, and the new rooms are just excellent. Best location: Close to all sights, but not quite in the rather suffocating city. Good breakfast. Nice view (to the valley and St. Catherine's church). From my window, I could fully see a major league soccer game like in the most expensive box... not disturbing but fascinating. This is not a "hotel de charme", but for a stay in Siena, the optimal home away from home - no comparison to the allegedly superior Grand Continental downtown.
reviews.title: Good little hotel
No problems here!
reviews.text: Getting to this hotel by car is like a rat going through maze. With all the one way streets, it took us a while to find the right combination of streets to get to their door. The hotel itself was very nice. The room we stayed in was awesome. It was modern, comfortable and with a safe, which is always nice. Francesca at the front desk was fantastic, although her co-worker, was quite possibly the snootiest man I've ever dealt with. The breakfast buffet was delicious and plentiful. It was a very short walking distance from Il Campo (which is a must!). Must recommed a restaurant we ate at, located in the walkway to the Il Campo, with tables on the steps. Wish I could remember the name of it but it was the best meal we ate in Italy.

We stayed at this hotel, which was generally nice and located close enough at the end of the little streets in the center to be rather convenient. However, we had a very big problem- the room had bedbugs! For those of you who have never seen these, they are little long brown bugs on the beds that will prick while you sleep and inject stuff into your body and you will see little blood stains onthe bed the next morning. These may not be life threatnening, but they do cause welts on your body and poison ivy like itching; you will need antibiotics for and should not be left untreated and taken seriously. We are in the process of contacting the hotel and hope they take this very seriously. You will see delayed reactions as we did when we got home to the states. There is apparently an epidemic across hotels in Europe and the US
reviews.title: Beware of bedbugs

Great hotel in Siena
reviews.text: The Jolly Hotel in Siena is an excellent place to stay. Rooms were big, location reasonably central. Customer service varied from excellent to poor. Tip one: if you are travelling around Italy, the bus station is just in front of the hotel (save the trip to get to the train station).

This was just an average hotel in Siena, nothing too exciting. The room we stayed in was modern and nice. It appears they are remodeling some rooms, so make sure to ask for a newer room - we walked by some rooms that maids were cleaning and noticed some were very outdated! Our room had a view out to the stadium which was nice as we parked in the stadium parking lot.
reviews.title: Average hotel, better options in Siena

reviews.text: The service was a bit to be desired compared to other hotels. . . one example is they they suddenly changed their mind about having a room with a double bed once they realized I was travelling with my partner. The breakfast was ok.
reviews.title: Good hotel in great location

reviews.text: Again all in all, not a bad hotel, but not a great hotel and would most likely stay elsewhere unless we were able to get a really low rate.
reviews.title: Jolly Siena great location, very comfortable

reviews.text: We stayed in the Jolly for three nights in August 2005. The hotel is very well situated on a square approximately 5 minutes walk from the main attractions in Siena. Our room faced outwards onto a busy square which was also the main bus terminus, the double glazing however blocked out all noise and the air conditioning meant there was no reason to have the windows open.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended
